name: Bitbucket
description: Free unlimited public and private repositories for academic users and teams.

name: GitHub
description: Personal account (normally $7/month) with unlimited private repositories while you're a student.

name: PyCharm, PhpStorm, WebStorm, AppCode, CLion, RubyMine, IntelliJ IDEA
description: Free professional developer tools from JetBrains.

name: Intel® Parallel Studio XE 2015
description: Tool suite which simplifies the design, development, debug, and tuning of code that utilizes parallel processing to boost application performance. Free for students.

name: Xamarin IDE
description: IDE for using C# for iOS, Android, Mac & Windows platforms. Free for students.

name: Visual Studio Community 2015
description: IDE for C#,Javascript, C++ and others. Latest release includes Xamarin.

name: Bootstrap Studio
description: IDE that creates responsive websites using the Bootstrap framework. Free for students.

name: Tower
description: Version control with git made easy. Students get a 50% discount.

name: GitKraken
description: Another free as in price desktop Git client. Based on Electron, runs on Windows, GNU/Linux, and Mac. To claim free 1-year PRO license, you must claim your Github Student Developer Pack and sign in to the desktop client w/ GitHub.

name: Digital Ocean
description: Digital Ocean provides $50 in hosting credit for every student that signs up for the Github Student Developer Pack.

name: Gwiddle
description: Gwiddle provides hosting for 2 websites, 5 mail accounts, 4 MySQL DBs, 4 cron jobs, 1.5GB bandwidth, and 2GB diskspace free to verified students. Includes online control panel, custom and subdomain support, and free storage upgrades for sites that are "solely educational in nature." Supports externally purchased SSL certs for HTTPS (use Let's Encrypt to get one free).

name: RoseHosting
description: RoseHosting offers a recurring 20% discount on all their managed Linux VPS and Shared hosting plans when paying monthly. Students can use the discount by applying the coupon code "STUDENT20". Valid for new customers only. Cannot be combined with any other offer.

name: Sketch
description: 50% off your copy of Sketch when you get an educational license.

name: Adobe Creative Cloud
description: Students save big with 60% off Creative Cloud.

name: Amazon Web Services
description: Access cloud content, training, collaboration tools, and AWS technology at no cost by joining AWS Educate today.

name: Send Grid
description: Student plan 15K free emails/month (normally limited to 200 free emails/day) while you're a student available via Github Student Developer Pack.

name: Travis CI
description: Private builds (normally $69/month) while you're a student available via Github Student Developer Pack.

name: StyleCI
description: Free Student Plan with access to StyleCI for up to five private repositories.

name: Stripe
description: Web and mobile payments, built for developers. Waived transaction fees on first $1,000 in revenue processed available via Github Student Developer Pack.

name: Bitnami
description: Install cloud applications in a single click. Business 3 plan (normally $49/month) for one year available via Github Student Developer Pack.

name: Yellow Circle
description: Offers a free online sandbox for students and teachers at all levels to learn and practice IT, networking, and programming skills by creating and configuring virtual routers, virtual machines, and virtual firewalls, load-balancers, and storage devices.

name: Mapbox
description: A mapping platform for developers. 5 GB of storage for your own custom data.

name: Transifex
description: A localization platform for translating digital content. 1 Free Year worth $99/month available via Github Student Developer Pack.

name: HackHands
description: Live programming help available 24/7. $25 in platform credit to students via Github Student Developer Pack.

name: NameCheap
description: One year domain name registration on the .me TLD (normally $18.99/year) via Github Student Developer Pack

name: NameCheap
description: One year SSL certificate (normally $9/year) via Github Student Developer Pack.

name: Astah
description: One Year Professional License

name: Axure RP
description: Free educational license of Axure RP Pro

name: Vertabelo
description: Visual database design online. 100% free academic accounts for students and lecturers who are learning or teaching database modeling.

name: Invision
description: Prototyping and Mockup tool

name: Framer
description: Prototyping tool. 50% off when you get an educational license.

name: CartoDB
description: Additional space & features for free accounts or 20% discount on paid accounts.

name: Tableau Desktop
description: One Year Professional License for Students.

name: SAS University Edition and SAS OnDemand Academic
description: The SAS University Edition is distributed as a virtual appliance for VirtualBox/VMWare. It runs in NAT mode on the prepackaged VM and hosts SAS Studio for use with a browser on the host computer. SAS OnDemand hosts SAS Studio for use in the cloud without installation. Both are free for students and teachers at any level.

name: Unity3D
description: Unity is one of the world's most widely used game engines. It has created industry standards in 3D interactive content design for game development, architectural visualizations, military simulations, advertising and more. Students are offered a yearly license of $100 USD.

name: Unreal Game Engine
description: Unreal Engine 4 is a complete suite of game development tools. From 2D mobile games to console blockbusters and VR, Unreal Engine 4 gives you everything you need to start, ship, grow and stand out from the crowd. Part of the Github Student Developer Pack

name: Autodesk Entertainment Creation Suite Ultimate
description: 3-Year License for students from Autodesk. Includes Autodesk Maya, 3DS MAX, Softimage, Motion Builder and Mudbox.

name: LastPass
description: Enjoy 6 months of LastPass Premium to help you manage your online life at school!

name: Microsoft Imagine (formerly DreamSpark)
description: Imagine is a Microsoft program that supports technical education by providing access to Microsoft software for learning, teaching and research purposes. Currently includes SQL Server 2012, 2014, and 2016; Windows Server 2008 R2, 2012 R2, and 2016 in DataCenter, Standard, and Essentials and Windows 8.1 Embedded Industry Pro. Also offers a free Azure App service plan (no credit card). Most students are also eligible for a free Windows 10 license through their school's OnTheHub WebStore.

name: Intel Tools for Students
description: Free access to the select Intel® Software Development Products, including: Intel® XDK, Intel® Video Pro Analyzer, Intel® System Studio, Intel® Parallel Studio XE Composer Edition and Intel® Parallel Studio XE Cluster Edition (includes Fortran and C/C++).
